articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gunmen from the Palestinian group Hamas took at least 200 hostages and killed about 1,400 people during an Oct. 7 dawn raid carried out from the Gaza Strip on communities and military bases in southern Israel.
articles.title: Hamas hostages: what we know so far

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former U.S. Representative Justin Amash said on Friday that several of his relatives had been killed when a Greek Orthodox church in the Gaza Strip was hit overnight by an Israeli air strike.
articles.title: Former U.S. Rep Amash says relatives killed in Gaza church air strike

articles.author: Aidan Lewis
articles.description: U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres used a visit to Egypt's crossing with the Gaza Strip on Friday to make an emotional appeal for aid trucks to move into the besieged enclave, days after the U.S. raised hopes of a diplomatic breakthrough.
articles.title: U.N. chief pleads for Gaza lifeline to be opened at border crossing

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Dozens of Hollywood actors and artists, including comedian Jon Stewart and Oscar-winning actor Joaquin Phoenix, wrote on Friday to U.S. President Joe Biden, urging him to press for a ceasefire in Israel and Gaza.
articles.title: 'History is watching:' Hollywood stars urge Biden to press for Israel, Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egypt holds a summit on the Gaza crisis on Saturday amid growing fears of a wider Middle East war but the absence of a top official from Israel's main ally the U.S. and some other leaders has dampened expectations for what it can achieve.
articles.title: Egypt peace summit may struggle to foster unity on Gaza conflict

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: U.S. credibility rallying support for issues like Ukraine may have been compromised, some diplomats said, after Washington this week blocked United Nations action to protect Palestinian civilians in Gaza from the war between Israel and Hamas.
articles.title: US veto at UN to shield Israel could weaken its Ukraine rallying cry

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: A blast at a Gaza hospital was not the result of an Israeli missile strike, but likely caused by a misfiring Palestinian rocket, the French military intelligence directorate (DRM) said on Friday.
articles.title: French military intelligence says Israeli strike not behind Gaza hospital blast

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to "fight until victory" in Gaza, signaling no pause in his military's bombardment and expected invasion of the enclave after Hamas released two U.S. hostages.
articles.title: Israel vows to 'fight until victory' after Hamas releases two U.S. hostages

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: Protesters from Jakarta to Tunis on Friday demanded an end to Israel's bombardment of Gaza after nearly two weeks of intense air and artillery strikes that authorities there say have killed 4,100 people.
articles.title: Muslims protest around world to demand end to Israel's Gaza campaign

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Friday temporarily lifted a partial gag order she had imposed limiting Donald Trump's public statements about the federal criminal case in which the former president is accusing of illegally attempting to undo his 2020 election loss.
articles.title: Judge temporarily lifts Trump gag order in federal 2020 election case
